intro: Tragacantha brevipes, commonly known as the short-footed tragacanth, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, erect growth habit. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small leaflets. Tragacantha brevipes is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is also known for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of gum.
